Detailed Description

The Dns class represents a request for information from a DNS server.

A DNS request can be one of two types, represented by the getHostByIPAddress() and GetHostByName() methods. The getHostByIPAddress() method represents a request for the DNS information about a host, while the getHostByHostname() method represents a request for the DNS host information for an IP address. Both requests can be made in an asynchronous mode. To query a host name, implement an IDNSListener, then query by: 

 gaia::net::IDNSListener *d = new HandleDns();
 gaia::net::DNS dns(d);
 dns.getHostByHostname(gaia::base::String("www.google.com"));
See also:
IDNSListener, IPHostEntry.
